s.name: Legendary
s.description: Life-changing experiences that redefined what I thought was possible. These trails pushed every limit and created memories I'll never forget.

trails.name: Mount Washington Presidential Traverse
trails.description: Brutal weather above treeline tested every piece of gear and every lesson learned. The most technically and mentally challenging hike I've ever completed.

trails.name: Half Dome Cable Route
trails.description: The cables section is pure exposure and determination. Standing on that summit with 360° views of Yosemite Valley was a religious experience.

a.name: Outstanding
a.description: Exceptional trails that combine stunning scenery, challenging terrain, and unforgettable moments. These are the hikes I recommend to experienced adventurers.

trails.name: Angels Landing Chain Section
trails.description: Mental game stronger than physical. The final half-mile chain section requires complete focus and zero fear of heights.

trails.name: Mount Katahdin - Knife Edge
trails.description: The Knife Edge traverse is Maine's most exposed ridge walk. Wind, weather, and technical scrambling make this a true adventure.

trails.name: Mount Whitney Summit Trail
trails.description: Highest peak in the lower 48. The altitude hit hard around 13,000 feet, but pushing through to 14,505 feet was pure determination.

b.name: Excellent
b.description: Solid, rewarding hikes with great scenery and moderate challenges. Perfect for building experience and enjoying beautiful landscapes without extreme difficulty.

trails.name: Old Rag Mountain Circuit
trails.description: Classic rock scramble with 360° views from the summit. The boulder field is playful and challenging without being dangerous.

trails.name: Mount Monadnock - White Dot Trail
trails.description: Short but steep with a rewarding bald summit. Perfect training hike that builds leg strength and confidence.

trails.name: Franconia Ridge Traverse
trails.description: Spectacular above-treeline ridge walk on a perfect fall day. The colors and views were absolutely stunning.

c.name: Good
c.description: Enjoyable hikes that serve their purpose but lack the wow factor of higher tiers. Good for training, easy days, or when conditions aren't ideal.

trails.name: Bear Mountain via Appalachian Trail
trails.description: Easy access from NYC made this a convenient training hike. Views were limited by haze, but good for building base fitness.

trails.name: Mount Major Trail
trails.description: Crowded family-friendly hike with decent lake views. Good for an easy day or bringing less experienced hikers.
